<font size="3">Google Plus _+1_ & Share to Stream Bookmarklet</font>
<br/>
== What does it do? ==
<table border="0" cellspacing="25" cellpadding="0" width="100%>
<tr>

<td><p><font size="3">*Functionally*</font></p>
<p>Whether bookmarklet utilities are stored as bookmarks or hyperlinks, they are designed to add one-click functionality to a browser or web page. <font size="1">(_[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bookmarklet Wikipedia]_)</font></p>
<p>Provides functionality to *_+1 and share pages_* to your Google Plus stream on-the-fly, *_as you browse the web_*, regardless of the website you are on.</p></td>

<td><p><font size="3">*Literally*</font></p>
<p>A bookmarklet is unobtrusive `JavaScript` stored as the URL of a bookmark in a web browser or as a hyperlink on a web page. <font size="1">(_[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bookmarklet Wikipedia]_)</font></p>
<p>When clicked, the JavaScript is injected into the page, hence executing the code.</p></td>

</tr>
</table>

==Usage==
  * click bookmarklet once to show
  * _+1_ and/or share the page you are on
  * click bookmarklet again to hide (or use the close button if you choose one of those variations)

Works best on your browser's bookmarks bar (if it has this
